intro: Pavonia sessiliflora var. acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wood rose, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features upright stems that can grow up to 3 meters tall, adorned with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 3–8 cm long. The plant produces showy, pink to red bracteate flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is well-suited for moist, well-drained soils.
